caller_intent: Ellie seeks clarification on two insurance-related matters: 1) Auto Owners' coverage for a log cabin home with mixed construction dates, and 2) Eligibility for Auto Owners' insurance programs despite a client's recent accident history.
resolution_steps: Jeremy explains Auto Owners' options for log cabin coverage: standard replacement cost (RCE) vs. functional replacement cost (modern materials).
He clarifies that functional replacement cost requires selecting the option on the policy screen under coverage J.

Regarding the second query, Jeremy outlines Auto Owners' three programs (Owners, Premier, Standard) and explains that recent at-fault accidents disqualify clients from higher tiers but may allow eligibility in the Standard program if the accident is older than 12 months.
knowledge_required: Auto Owners' coverage options for historic homes
RCE (Replacement Cost Estimate) process and policy adjustments
Auto Owners' program eligibility criteria (accident history impact)
systems_referenced: Auto Owners policy management system (coverage J selection)
summary: Ellie consults Jeremy about Auto Owners' coverage for a log cabin with modern upgrades and eligibility for insurance programs despite a client's accident history. Jeremy explains functional replacement cost options and program tier requirements, noting state-specific variations and the 12-month accident disqualification rule.
